for people with Parkinson's disease
Scientists in Switzerland are using
robots to induce hallucinations in people with
the disease, according to research published
March 12. One of the symptoms of
Parkinson's disease is that the patient
tends to see more  more people than
reality on a photo projected on a
screen. Researchers combined
VR and robotics to
simulate this illusion effect when counting people,
for which the research team used a
finger.  The robot hand pokes the patient's back
but does not synchronize their movements
with this technology.
Normal healthy people also have hallucinations similar to
people with Parkinson's disease. Research
confirms that this finding can help
identify and monitor people with Parkinson's disease.  Monitor patients at
risk of cognitive decline and
help prevent early-onset B-kinson disease.
